text: that we've been bringing you out of
Italy two passenger trains have crashed
head-on in southern Italy the latest
that we have from firefighters at the
scene is that at least 12 people have
been killed in this head-on collision
it's just north of Bari which is in the
heel of the boot it's the Puglia region
of Italy and Bari is the the regional
capital of Puglia the details that we
have are that the two trains were on a
single track line at the time of the
crash heading between Barry and Violetta
which is just north of Bari I think
we've got some pictures actually to show
you the Train one of the trains on the
tracks the emergency services it's
actually happened in an olive grove and
it's a very rural part of italy these
two trains were travelling on a single
track when they collided head-on
passenger trains not clear at this stage
how many passengers were travelling on
those trains but emergency services have
been trying to free passengers from the
wrecked carriages and the local fire
brigade commander has told local
television I think there are many dead
the latest figure that they're putting
on it is at least 12 dead with many more
injured and reports saying that several
children have been brought out of the
wreckage alive so that's the latest that
we have from the scene no immediate
cause given for why it happened that
those two trains were traveling on the
same stretch of single track heading
towards each other but this all just
unfolding we'll keep you updated as we
get more details
